qas.question: When was the Namibian Constitution adopted?
When did the country of Namibia officially become a country?
Who was the first President of Namibia?
Who swore in the first President of Namibia?
What was ceded to Namibia in 1994?
Until what year did Sam Nujoma serve as President of Namibia?
For how many days had Nelson Mandela been imprisoned?
In what month and year did Namibian leaders start to develop their constitution?
When was the first Namibian vote held for president?
What was one of the countries that sent a head of state to Namibia for the first presidential swearing-in?

context: The Namibian Constitution adopted in <a0_0><b7_0><b8_0>February <b6_0>1990<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/> incorporated protection for human rights, compensation for state expropriations of private property, an independent judiciary and an executive presidency (the constituent assembly became the national assembly). The country officially became independent on <a1_0>21 March 1990<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Sam Nujoma<a2_0/> was sworn in as the first President of Namibia watched by <a3_0>Nelson Mandela<a3_0/> (who had been released from prison the previous month) and representatives from 147 countries, including 20 heads of state. <a4_0>Walvis Bay<a4_0/> was ceded to Namibia in <b5_0>1994<b5_0/> upon the end of Apartheid in <b9_0>South Africa<b9_0/>.[citation needed]
